column4: Hi I am new to Linux, I need some help with Ubuntu installation
where are you stuck?
thanks DBO, base installation
what part is confusing you?
i have three partitions on the master drive,with win xp pro on one of them, I am trying to install Ubuntu on another which has no files. The file system on the partitions is NTFS
are you at the point of the installer where you set up the partitions?
The installer keeps telling me that it cant find a base/root
yes, DBO i have been there twice
when you get there, go to the part (sorry I dont know the exact quotes here) that lets you manually edit the partitions
I did try to edit partitions manually
in there you can delete the partition you want to isntall ubuntu on
then use the option to "go back" or whatever they called it, and select "use largest contiguous free space"
should be easy sailing from there
i am not sure, I will have to see that. Do i ned to recreate the partition ?
no, it will do it
will largest contiguous free space give me the option to install on a particular partition ?
it will install to whatever partition you deleted in the manual editing step
whatever I deleted ?
all right DBO, I will try out your suggestions
Thanks for your time, DBO
im sorry I cant be more clear, I dont know what it says line for line
but I know your problem, and this is how you fix it
that was enough help, I didnt ecpect more than that. Thanks again!
dont be afraid to ask again if you get stuck
